title: Accommodation
content: Living in UU's student accommodation gives you exclusive access to activities, events and trips that help you to settle in and make new friends. Do you know that you have access to 24/7 support? Whatever you need, the team are ready to support you.

title: UU Sport
content: Sport is a big part of life at Ulster and there is something to suit all levels and interests. Why not try a class with your friends or give the gym a go? The facilities offer affordable student rates.

title: Student Wellbeing
content: The Student Wellbeing team offers advice and support on your general wellbeing, money matters, counselling, and disabilities, including mental health conditions, dyslexia and ASD. Depending on your needs, speak to the team in person, via telephone or online.

title: UUSU
content: You automatically become a member of the Students’ Union UUSU from your first day. They are your voice in the university and here to represent and support you. The calendar is packed with events, activities, clubs and societies so you can really get involved in student life. The team are also here to offer advice and support on your studies and personal issues.

title: Student Admin/Registry
content: Registry Services are here to help you manage your student academic record, offer support with student finance queries and completion of forms requiring official UU approval. Our teamare available via telephone, email, live chat and on campus.

title: Library
content: Your on-campus library provides everything you need to support your learning in one central location with resources, study spaces, specialist help and computing facilities. Check out the online 'Library Help' service to get in touch with the library, borrow books and check study space availability. You can also access an extensive range of electronic learning materials at any time.

title: Food Outlet
content:
The campus has lots of value for money places to get a coffee or lunch:
  • Flow & Co (Block E)
  • Brew Bridge (The Bridge)
  • Bann View Social @ UUSU Coleraine (Block E)
  • Truva (Riverside Theatre)
  • Little Coffee Co. (Block I)
  • Spar and Post Office (The Bridge)
If you bring a packed lunch, the kitchenette (E019) has a microwave, toaster and a hot water boiler.

title: International Student Advisory
content: The dedicated team for international students providing support, information and advice.

title: Transport
content: For students aged 16-23, a Translink yLink card provides 1/3 off on all bus and rail services within Northern Ireland. You can choose to travel to the campus by bus or train. If you’d rather cycle, you can securely store your bike.
